meanings.definition: Spoken or sung with audible breath
meanings.sent1: Her breathy voice filled the room with a gentle sound.
meanings.sent2: The singer's breathy performance captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The breathy whispers in the library made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The breathy tone of her speech was like a soft breeze.
meanings.sent5: The breathy quality of her voice was soothing and calming.

meanings.sent1: The breathy wind rustled the leaves in the trees.
meanings.sent2: The breathy music played in the background of the movie.
meanings.sent3: The breathy laughter of the children echoed in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her breathy sigh conveyed a sense of contentment.
meanings.sent5: The breathy sound of the waves crashing on the shore was peaceful.

meanings.sent1: The breathy sound of his asthma attack was concerning.
meanings.sent2: The breathy noise coming from the old house was eerie.
meanings.sent3: The breathy panting of the dog after a run was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The breathy gasps of the hiker could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent5: The breathy wheezing of the patient indicated a need for medical attention.

meanings.definition: Producing sound with an audible exhalation
meanings.sent1: She breathily sang the high notes with ease.
meanings.sent2: The exhausted runner breathily crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent3: He breathily whispered the secret to his friend.
meanings.sent4: The singer breathily performed the emotional ballad.
meanings.sent5: The actor breathily delivered the lines to convey the character's emotion.
